intro: Microlicia restingae, commonly known as the Restinga microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It is a small shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas with sandy soils, adapted to the harsh conditions of the restinga ecosystem. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive aromatic scent, which helps in attracting pollinators. Microlicia restingae plays an important role in maintaining the biodiversity of its native habitat.
